availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Willis F. Martin (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Robert E. Martin and Elizabeth E. Martin. Married to Jemima Nooe Martin in Mercer County, Kentucky in January 1856. Father of Charles E. Martin and Mollie Martin May. Resident of Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eleven enslaved persons in Clark County in 1850. Farmer in Clark County in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Clark County in 1860. Household held an additional eight enslaved persons in trust for R. Martin in Clark County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 261.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 868.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 2, p. 345A.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film 000191863.
"Willis F. Martin (1828-1868)," Find A Grave, Memorial 25033766, accessed April 13, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/25033766.
